result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Kizirian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler J. Kizirian in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:30 am. Court has given defendant options and that is why hear today.  Def. has chosen probation, Def. would agree to probation sentence.  Court will exempt jail time, Expungement will not be an option.  Def. has nothing to say. Court orders  200 DNA surcharge & DNA Sample, court costs, Def. given p.p. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Clerk makes statement Court is orders what was ordered previously 100 fine plus costs, withheld jail sentence years 1 year probation, no payment plan.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
of Proceeding Plea and Sentencing on 5-5-16

Defendant Tyler J. Kizirian in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 11:52 am  Plea agreement.  Amend Ct 1 to 947.01 to disorderly conduct, def to plea to amended charge.  Expungement requested.  Victim impact statement filed.  Parties argree to plea agreement as stated.  Court will amend to disorderly conduct.  Plea advisement form completed and filed.  Reviewed by Court.  No contest plea entered to amend charge.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed. Court finds def understand charge, penalties & rights.   Def finds plea entered freely & voluntarily.  Factual basis for plea Plea accepted, found guilty.  Sentencing arguments presented by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Atty Grubofski presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.   Court orders probation, counseling as recommended.  Setence withheld, 1 yr probation.  Fine $100.00 plus cost.  Option for def, if expungement requested,  20 days jail.  To be served after 18th birthday, huber privileges.  If no jail, no expungement.  Def request time to think about this.    Sentencing will be concluded at this time.  Bond will coninue  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Not to use cell phone during school hours or possession of cell phone during school.   No contact with CMMS

Defendant Tyler J. Kizirian in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received and waive reading.  State request signature bond, conditions.  Statement by Atty Grubofski.  Court sets bond.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Court reviews right to preliminary within time limits.  Def waive time limits  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
